29:46 This part really makes me tear up since I have been the army for 8 years and moa since predebut, and I know how hard this boy really works for their dreams.ğŸ˜¢
It's true, there is no other group out there like BTS.  A lot of artists have a hard time giving generously to up and coming artists because they're worried about being replaced and they want to stay relevant so they withhold information they've acquired in order to maintain their own status.  But BTS is so genuinely kind and thoughtful that they go out of their way to mentor other artists and look for ways to take care of the next generation.  It's really quite remarkable the scope of their generosity in caring for others. ğŸ’œğŸ’œğŸ’œ We see how well they've cared for one another since they became a group.  All from different backgrounds and they gave of themselves to each other. ğŸ’œğŸ’œğŸ’œ Every time I think of Jin being the maknae of his family and being treated as such to suddenly being the eldest of the group and the way he took care of Jungkookie from the very beginning and gave him the love and nurturing as the maknae that he was accustomed to receiving always makes my heart swell.  Jin was so selfless on behalf of the group and it wasn't just JK that he took care of and nurtured, it was the whole maknae line that he did that for.  He put himself in harms way to take care of Jimin when Jimin was being threatened....ğŸ˜¢ğŸ˜­ğŸ’œ And it's clear that they all put the group ahead of themselves to do what is in the best interest of the group as a whole and no one member tries to outshine the others.  They all shine and have so much talent to offer and they all support and lift up one another.  They really are great examples of how to balance pride with humility and how to be of service to others. ğŸ’œğŸ’œğŸ’œ It's no wonder that Army feels so much love for them because even though most of us will never meet them personally and so many have never had the opportunity yet to see them perform live, we still feel that same sort of nurturing from BTS that they give to those they meet personally.  They still very much concern themselves with taking care of Army that they feel about taking care of anyone else in their orbit.  It's really special and I just love these guys so much.

Its the fact that people forget that TXT became trainees even before BTS got so big.  And tbh, at first, TXT were just the "brother group of BTS" for me too. I supported them but i didn't pay much attention to them. I would try to find some similarities between the two groups as well. But last year, i finally gave TXT a chance and soon i stopped seeing them as just "the brother group of BTS". They now have their own identity in my mind. And although I'm not a Moa, i can still appreciate the amazing discography that they have.  Comparison with BTS is something that couldn't have been avoided but it's because TXT were so capable themselves that they were able to make a name of their own.

12:44 what Yeonjun said is a very great advice, in any context. Often when things are very happy or very sad, we don't see the struggles of people who are supporting us. We tend to think oh that's what they ought to be doing. But NO the person is by your side, putting aside their pain, helping you through your pain please do the least and thank them and let them know you appreciate them.  Don't do the mistake of taking anything for granted, you'll never know when it gets over.  Don't be regretful be grateful.

I know that they want to perform at bigger stages for MOA, but I went to their concert last year in Sugarland, Texas, and it was sooooo nice being able to see them in a smaller venue (about 6k capacity). I'm actually glad I got to see them before they do big stadium concerts because the whole thing just felt more personal to me and I could see them a lot better. They were also able to actually run around the venue and interact with MOA and it was such a great experience. I know they'll be selling out stadiums in their future tours, but I did adore being able to attend their concerts while the venue was still small.

i had to take so many breaks from watching because if i didn't, i would have ended up crying and i cannot afford another mental breakdown rn. finally finished watching this 30-minute video after almost 2 hours... ;; i'll have to watch this again some day without breaks to fully appreciate everything, but even as is rn, i feel so happy to have started stanning txt.  i'm j a baby moa who started stanning them when srr promotions were j beginning, so i still have a lot about all members to learn and a lot of txt's history to understand, but yeonjun and taehyun's love for moas, bts, and of course, txt, was so overwhelming. personally, i have, and still do, have a certain kind of boundary between idols and fans that i keep to - it's j a way to make sure there's no dependency and a constant reality check, of course, but the way yeonjun and taehyun were talking about moas made my heart so full. the pure sincerity and appreciation they have for all moas was just... wow.  as two of the members who have the most ambition for the team, it's so wonderful to see them appear together and talk about their hopes and dreams for the team. their dreams for the team will always be supported by the others too, but i genuinely do just hope they all take care of themselves. aiming for the top is natural in most humans, but i just hope they don't forget about their health. i'm sure moas would love to see them succeed without overbearing pain, first and foremost! i understand their passion, but i do hope that they can also constantly see their progress instead of seeing what they're currently lacking.  anyways, i'm really so glad i started stanning txt, and i can't wait for a day when i get to be a part of the sea of moas to see them perform live in front of me.
